description.div: Investigations into architecture, interior design and related design fields--the forces that shape these fields and the processes of production upon which they rely.

course.title: Visual Literacy Lab: Analysis and/or Composition

prerequisite.div: ARTP: Art major or candidate for teaching endorsement in art. ARCH: Admission to the College of Architecture. IDES: Admission to the College of Architecture. JGEN: College of Journalism and Mass Communications major and 2.75 GPA. LARC: Admission to the College of Architecture. TXCD: Textiles, Clothing and Design major or minor.

description.div: Development of creative and perceptual analytic skills through problem solving in design. Composition and analysis.

prerequisite.div: ARTP: Art major or candidate for teaching endorsement in art. ARCH: Admission to the College of Architecture. IDES: Admission to the College of Architecture. JGEN: College of Journalism and Mass Communications major and 2.75 GPA. LARC: Admission to the College of Architecture. TXCD: Textiles, Clothing and Design major or minor.

description.div: Development of creative and perceptual analytic skills through problem solving in drawing and design. Composition and perceptual drawing.

prerequisite.div: ARTP: Art major or candidate for teaching endorsement in art. ARCH: Admission to the College of Architecture. IDES: Admission to the College of Architecture. JGEN: College of Journalism and Mass Communications major and 2.75 GPA. LARC: Admission to the College of Architecture. TXCD: Textiles, Clothing and Design major or minor.

description.div: Development of creative and perceptual analytic skills through problem solving in drawing and design. Composition and color theory application.

prerequisite.div: ARTP: Art major or candidate for teaching endorsement in art. ARCH: Admission to the College of Architecture. IDES: Admission to the College of Architecture. JGEN: College of Journalism and Mass Communications major and 2.75 GPA. LARC: Admission to the College of Architecture. TXCD: Textiles, Clothing and Design major or minor.

description.div: Development of creative and perceptual analytic skills through problem solving in drawing and design. Composition and perceptual drawing.

prerequisite.div: ARTP: Art major or candidate for teaching endorsement in art. ARCH: Admission to the College of Architecture. IDES: Admission to the College of Architecture. JGEN: College of Journalism and Mass Communications major and 2.75 GPA. LARC: Admission to the College of Architecture. TXCD: Textiles, Clothing and Design major or minor.

description.div: Introduction to issues in Visual Literacy as they relate to art and design. Formal and critical analysis.

prerequisite.div: ARCH/ARTP/JGEN/IDES/LARC/TXCD 140A, 140B, 141A, 141B, and 143.

description.div: Formal analysis and abstract design applied to the making of spatial and formal constructs with specific attention towards strategies of order and proportion. Focus on the process of design through organizational and graphic techniques derived from explicit relationships, physical and digital modeling, orthographic projection, free hand drawing, and other forms of graphic representation.

course.title: Elements of Architecture and Interior Design

prerequisite.div: ARCH/IDES/LARC 210.

description.div: The fundamentals of material, structural and assembly tectonics in the design of inhabited environments. Specific consideration is given to strategies of design research as projects are explored in relation to aperture and threshold, movement and sequence, structure and enclosure in conjunction with program and means. Continued development of the ability to transform ideas, using various forms of representation, into spatial and formal design projects in pursuit of fully synthesized environments.
Application of computer technology to architectural and interior design. Effective use of computer technology to aid investigation in design studios.

prerequisite.div: Formal acceptance into the Interior Design Program or permission. Parallel: IDES 350.

description.div: In-depth study of the materials with which an interior designer is concerned: floor coverings, wall coverings, lighting and lighting fixtures, window treatments, and accessories.

prerequisite.div: IDES 300; formal acceptance into the interior design program; parallel IDES 350.

description.div: Structure and surface materials for interior designers and their role in the design process. Conceptual application of materials and the affects that they make in interior environments.

prerequisite.div: IDES 300. Parallel: IDES 351.

description.div: Legal, business, and ethical procedures and practices of interior design.

prerequisite.div: Admission to the third year architecture or Interior Design Program.

description.div: Architectural lighting and acoustical systems of buildings for non-engineers. Fundamentals of light and vision, lighting equipment, requirements for building lighting, fundamentals of sound and hearing, room acoustics, noise control, and basic design methods for both architectural lighting and acoustics.

prerequisite.div: Acceptance into Third Year architecture or Interior Design Program.

description.div: Lighting in residential and commercial use as it affects color, psychology, and use of space. Application, specification and evaluation of various systems.

prerequisite.div: Junior standing, AHIS 101 or 102.

description.div: History and development of European interiors and furnishings from the ancient world through the French and English styles of the early nineteenth century.

prerequisite.div: Formal acceptance into the Interior Design Program by faculty. Parallel: IDES 300.

description.div: Emphasis on the design process in the development of problem solving skills related to interior design and the proximate environment, such as interior space planning, programming, and generation of design concept and design alternatives.

prerequisite.div: IDES 300 and 350. Parallel: IDES 318.

description.div: Intermediate projects in creative problem solving with emphasis on programming, spacial analysis, and specifications for commercial interiors.

prerequisite.div: Junior standing or permission.

description.div: Practical investigation in the use of materials and their fabrication process with emphasis on wood, plastic, and steel. Generate a design from conception to a finished product.

course.title: Design in an Age of Digital Environments

prerequisite.div: Admission to the BSD program.

description.div: Digital environments and their implications for design. Types of digital environments: intelligent reality, real virtual reality, and neural reality. These environments have qualities which provide unique challenges for their design: intelligence, temporal sequencing, and interactivity. Alternative design processes for handling these special qualities.

prerequisite.div: Admission to the professional program in interior design or permission.

description.div: Basic set of construction documents for a small residential or commercial space. Set includes demolition, partition, and reflected ceiling plans, power and communication plans, finish and furnishings plans, interior elevations, sections, details and schedules. Expression of design intent as construction documents is reinforced in lecture, structured studio experiences, and site visits.

course.title: History of Interiors and Designed Objects

prerequisite.div: Admission to the professional program in interior design or architecture.

description.div: History and development of interiors and furnishings from prehistoric times to the present day, emphasizing the eighteenth, nineteenth, and twentieth centuries. Interiors and furnishings focused on the West yet considered within a global context.

prerequisite.div: IDES 318 and 351.

description.div: Advanced application of the design process with emphasis on complex residential and commercial problems, including systems design, and individual professional objectives.

prerequisite.div: IDES 450, prior or concurrent work experience in interior design or related field.

description.div: Design of multipurpose interior (contract and residential) spaces with complete drawings and specifications. Individual and team problems.

course.title: Behavioral and Social Factors in Environmental Design

description.div: Survey of theory, methods, research, and findings from the social and behavioral sciences as they relate to architectural design, interior design and regional and community planning. Application of principles to the development of architectural and interiors programs and designs and to the planning process.

Survey and integration of theory, methods, research and findings from the social, behavioral, and managerial sciences as they relate to the design of work environments. Factors effecting change in the contemporary workplace.

course.title: Preservation and Conservation of Historic Interiors

prerequisite.div: IDES 340.

description.div: Restoration, conservation, renovation, or adaptive reuse of historic interiors. Energy feasibility for the older structure.

prerequisite.div: Admission to the BSD program or permission.

description.div: Intensive study of particular historical and contemporary contributions by women to the design professions related to the built environment. Evaluation of design work by and about women seen in their aesthetic and intellectual context. Examinations of the roles and values of women in design and their impact on the assumptions and issues currently held by the profession.

prerequisite.div: Admission to the third year in architecture or Interior Design Program; or permission.

description.div: Advanced color theories and their application to the Built environment.

course.title: Domesticity and Power in the Colonial World

description.div: Re-examines the relationship between architecture, politics, and ethical values by looking at colonial architecture as a world-wide phenomenon. The colonial domestic sphere is viewed as a counterpoint to the public arena.

course.title: Material Culture: The Social Life of Things

description.div: The theories and practices of material culture. History and interior design--and the broad category of humanity itself--through the lens of material objects.

prerequisite.div: Admission to the BSD Program.

description.div: Contemporary and controversial issues. Nuances of the field and practice of interior design and its relationship to the allied design disciplines.
Group investigation of a topic in interior design originated by instructor.
Individual investigation of a topic in interior design.

course.title: Design Problems in the Interior Built Environment

prerequisite.div: Permission

description.div: Strategies for teaching and learning directly related to studio education.

course.title: Research Methods in Architecture and Interior Design

description.div: Research methods employed by the diverse specializations within the disciplines of architecture and interior design. Methods which contribute to a theoretical and informational body of knowledge as well as those contributing directly to design application.

prerequisite.div: Permission

notes.div: IDES *895 requires computer, email, and Internet access.
